and then you can download it using urllib.request

Get the image URL from this code
```import requests
import json

# You can get your own api key at <https://api.nasa.gov>

r = requests.get("<https://api.nasa.gov/planetary/apod?api_key=YOUR_API_KEY>")

json_format = json.loads(r.text)

#You can get the image url by using the hdurl key
image_url = json_format["hdurl"]

print(image_url)```
<https://api.nasa.gov|https://api.nasa.gov>
NASA has a image of the day API that provides the url of HD image and also provides some other facts about that image
Yeah I know how to do it
this part is fairly easy! I mean't to pull the image of the day to get it

```import ctypes
```

```# Set the path of the wallpaper image.
wallpaper_path = "C:\\path\\to\\wallpaper.jpg"
```

```# Set the style of the wallpaper.
# 0: Center, 1: Stretch, 2: Tile, 6: Fit.
wallpaper_style = 0
```

```# Load the image.
image = ctypes.c_wchar_p(wallpaper_path)
```

```# Set the wallpaper.
SPI_SETDESKWALLPAPER = 20
ctypes.windll.user32.SystemParametersInfoW(SPI_SETDESKWALLPAPER, 0, image, 0)
```
